title: Muhammadu Buhari, the uncommon president - Daily Trust
text:
Today, we stand together, hearts heavy yet hopeful, to pay tribute to an extraordinary man—former President Muhammadu Buhari—who left us on July 13, 2025, at 82. His passing marks the end of a life that was anything but ordinary. A life that began in the quiet village of Daura and rose to shape the soul of our nation. Today, we don’t just mourn a leader; we honour a beacon of resilience, integrity, and unwavering love for Nigeria.
 And as we pay tribute to Muhammadu Buhari, let his story inspire us to rise above our challenges and build the Nigeria he dreamed of. This is our tribute to you, Baba Buhari showed us that greatness isn’t about where you start—it’s about where you’re determined to go. When you stepped into Aso Rock in 2015, Nigeria was on its knees—Boko Haram’s terror, corruption’s grip, and an economy teetering on the edge. You didn’t shy away. You promised “Change,” and you fought for it with every ounce of your being.
Furthermore, you recovered millions in stolen funds, launched N-Power to empower our youth, and gave millions of families hope through the Conditional Cash Transfer Program. Were there setbacks? Yes. Did every plan work perfectly? No. But your heart was always with Nigeria, and for that, we salute you. Your life wasn’t just about policy, it was about principle. You lived modestly, even as president. You faced illness with courage, laughing off wild rumours of a body double with that quiet humour we came to love, saying, “It’s the real me, I assure you.” You showed us that vulnerability and strength could coexist. And when you left office, you returned to Daura, not to a mansion but to a life of simplicity, claiming you struggled financially like so many Nigerians. That honesty, that humanity, is why we honour you today. Ba ba Buhari, we say: Thank you for being uncommon. Thank you for showing us that integrity matters, that discipline can rebuild, and that a single heart can carry a nation’s hopes.
SPONSOR AD Now, my fellow Nigerian and well-wishers, this tribute isn’t just words—it’s a call to action. Buhari’s life challenges us to rise above our struggles. Maybe you’re facing hardship today, money’s tight, dreams feel distant, or the weight of life feels too heavy. Let Buhari’s story remind you: you are stronger than your challenges. He didn’t let the loss stop him.
As we say farewell, we pray for you, Baba. May your soul rest in Aljannatul Firdaus. May your vision for a united, disciplined Nigeria live on in us.
Saidu Bn Malik wrote via [email protected] .

author: @gurufocus
title: Pembina Pipeline Corp (PBA) Announces Joint Venture for Greenlight Electricity and Data Centre ...
text:
Pembina Pipeline Corp (PBA, Financial) has announced a strategic partnership with Kineticor Asset Management LP to acquire a 50% interest in the Greenlight Electricity Centre Limited Partnership. This venture aims to develop a multi-phased, gas-fired power generation facility with a capacity of up to 1,800 MW, including carbon capture options. The project, located in Alberta's Industrial Heartland, will also accommodate a co-located data centre complex. The announcement was made on February 27, 2025.
Positive Aspects
- The partnership leverages Pembina's existing asset base and Kineticor's expertise in power generation.
- The project supports Alberta's vision for a thriving data centre industry with a $100 billion investment target by 2030.
- Strategic location near transmission lines and utility infrastructure enhances project feasibility.
- Potential for carbon capture and emissions reduction aligns with sustainability goals.
Negative Aspects
- The project is still in the early stages of the Alberta Electric System Operator interconnection process.
- There may be challenges in securing long-term power offtake agreements with data centre customers.
- Potential regulatory and environmental hurdles could delay project timelines.
Financial Analyst Perspective
From a financial standpoint, Pembina's investment in the Greenlight Electricity Centre represents a strategic move to diversify its portfolio and tap into the growing demand for reliable power solutions in Alberta. The partnership with Kineticor could enhance Pembina's revenue streams by providing power to the burgeoning data centre industry. However, investors should be mindful of the project's early-stage status and potential risks associated with regulatory approvals and market demand fluctuations.
Market Research Analyst Perspective
The joint venture between Pembina and Kineticor is well-positioned to capitalize on Alberta's ambitious data centre investment goals. The project's modular design allows for scalability, aligning with market demand. The strategic location in Alberta's Industrial Heartland offers a competitive advantage due to its proximity to essential infrastructure. However, the success of the project will depend on securing reliable power offtake agreements and navigating potential regulatory challenges.
Frequently Asked Questions
What is the Greenlight Electricity Centre?
The Greenlight Electricity Centre is a proposed multi-phased gas-fired power generation facility with a capacity of up to 1,800 MW, including carbon capture options.
Who are the partners in this joint venture?
Pembina Pipeline Corp and Kineticor Asset Management LP are the partners in this joint venture.
What is the significance of the project's location?
The project is strategically located in Alberta's Industrial Heartland, near transmission lines, utility infrastructure, and carbon sequestration facilities, enhancing its feasibility and potential for success.
What are the potential benefits of this project?
The project aims to support Alberta's growing data centre industry, provide reliable power solutions, and contribute to the province's $100 billion data centre investment target by 2030.
 Read the original press release here.

It does not formulate a recommendation to purchase or divest any stock and does not consider individual investment objectives or financial circumstances. author: Favour Adegoke
title: Gisele Bündchen Reportedly Craving Brazilian Dishes Amid Her Pregnancy
text:
Gisele Bündchen is expecting a child with her boyfriend, Joaquim Valente , and has reportedly been indulging in Brazilian-inspired dishes to satisfy her pregnancy cravings.
The supermodel, who was recently seen showing her baby bump in Miami, is planning a home birth and will wait to learn the baby’s sex.
The pregnancy news surprised her ex-husband, Tom Brady, with whom Gisele Bündchen shares two children.
Article continues below advertisement
Gisele Bündchen’s Pregnancy Cravings Revealed MEGA According to a source who recently spoke to the Daily Mail , Bündchen has been craving dishes reminiscent of her childhood in Brazil, such as “grilled ribeye with chimichurri sauce and sautéed greens.”
The insider shared that to satisfy her cravings, the supermodel “is cooking those dishes at home with her kids.”
The 44-year-old supermodel has been enjoying banana smoothies for breakfast, and lunch often consists of pesto chicken wrapped in lettuce.
The source also highlighted that Bündchen is a “great cook,” effortlessly creating “incredible” meals using a “lot of fresh vegetables with spices.”
They noted that the cookbook author often treated her former partners, Tom Brady and Leonardo DiCaprio, to her homemade Brazilian dishes.
Article continues below advertisement
“Tom and Leo loved it when she brought home fresh ingredients and whipped up her Brazilian dishes,” the source shared. “It is a big part of her overall charm that she is quite domestic in many ways.”
Bündchen reportedly always took on the chef role in her relationships, “Now, she’s cooking for Joaquim.”
Article continues below advertisement
The Model Plans Home Birth And Keeps Baby’s Gender A Surprise MEGA News of Bündchen’s pregnancy first surfaced in late October, when an insider shared with People Magazine that “Gisele and Joaquim are happy for this new chapter in their life, and they’re looking forward to creating a peaceful and loving environment for the whole family.”
Another source told TMZ that the supermodel is about five to six months pregnant, with her due date expected in early 2025.
However, Bündchen reportedly plans to wait until the birth to learn the baby’s sex. She is also preparing for a home birth, with a source telling the outlet that she’s “excited” for the experience.
Article continues below advertisement
Gisele Bündchen And Her Boyfriend Reportedly Have No Immediate Plans To Marry MEGA Bündchen and her jiu-jitsu instructor boyfriend, Valente, were recently spotted together, marking their first public appearance since news of their pregnancy broke.
While the couple are embracing this exciting new phase, a source shared that they aren’t planning to marry “anytime soon” and will simply “live together for now.”
“There is a huge difference between them net-worth wise,” the source noted. “There is no point in tempting fate as far as Giselle is concerned.”
Bündchen first met Valente in December 2021. The two began making headlines after they were spotted together on multiple occasions in late 2022, though she initially denied any romantic involvement.
By February, sources told Page Six the couple started dating in June 2023 and shared that they were “deeply in love.”
Article continues below advertisement
Her Pregnancy News Shocked Her Ex-Husband Tom Brady MEGA Bündchen’s pregnancy was revealed approximately two years after her split from NFL star Tom Brady, whom she was married to for 13 years, sharing two children: 14-year-old Benjamin and 11-year-old Vivian.
According to a report, Bündchen broke the news of her third pregnancy to Brady and their kids before it was made public.
An insider also told Page Six that the news came as a shock to Brady.
“It just wasn’t something that was on his radar,” the source said. “So when Gisele broke the news to him, he was stunned, to say the least.”
However, Brady is reportedly single and remains “super focused on his kids and work.”
Gisele Bundchen And Tom Brady Considered Having A Third Child Before Their Divorce MEGA According to Page Six , Bündchen and Brady were open to the idea of expanding their family by having another child.
Despite their readiness to add one more, it was not something they focused on while they were still married.
“Gisele and Tom were open to having another child during their marriage,” a close source told the outlet about the couple. “But it wasn’t something they were actively trying to do.”
The duo eventually went their separate ways in October 2022, ending their 13 years of marriage after months of speculations that they were having marital issues.
Source link

author: mst225
title: Nirmal Srinivasan, MPS ‘23, on the advice that helped him land a job in data science
text:
December 5, 2024
By Louis DiPietro
Resilience is a requirement in the job market. Nirmal Srinivasan, MPS ’23, would add adaptability, too.
“I would keep applying for a lot of jobs and get all these rejections. I’m thinking, ‘What am I doing wrong?’” Srinivasan said of his time as a Cornell graduate student in the Master of Professional Studies in data science and applied statistics. “This classmate used to joke with us, saying, ‘You guys actually don't need to apply for jobs; you just need to keep talking to people.’ That thought stayed in my head. At the start of my second semester, I reframed my objectives.”
Granted, Srinivasan still applied for jobs, but he made networking a priority in the latter half of his MPS experience. He had the skills. Afterall, the education he received in Cornell’s one-year MPS program in data science and applied statistics was, and continues to be, highly coveted across industries. He just needed to find the right job, and networking provided a roadmap, he said.
“If you’re looking for jobs, that’s the roadmap: talk to as many people as you can,” he said.
Today, Srinivasan is a senior data professional at Lumen Technologies, a telecommunications company. At Lumen, where he has worked since July 2023, he describes his role as a mix of both data analyst and data scientist – someone who generates meaningful insights from data and comes up with recommendations for company leadership.
“A lot of my MPS classes helped me in my current job, especially starting right out,” he said.
For example, he spent his early days at Lumen working on prediction models – the foundations of which he learned in two courses from his MPS experience, Data Mining and Machine Learning (STSCI 5740) and Applied Time Series Analysis (STSCI 5550).
His path to Cornell and the MPS program came after dabbling in machine learning and computer vision research as an undergraduate engineering major in India.
“When you look beneath the machine learning and deep learning, it’s all math and statistics,” he said. “That was my starting point in switching from engineering to data science.”
Srinivasan cites three factors that lured him from across the planet to Ithaca, and to Cornell’s MPS in data science and applied statistics program: the Big Red’s Ivy League renown and brand value on a résumé, a strong alumni network, and a rigorous, relevant curriculum with direct application to jobs in industry. All three factors proved valid, particularly the rigor of the MPS curriculum. It wasn’t easy, he said.
“I didn’t realize that statistics could get this deep.”
But he sought out professors during office hours and stayed on top of his coursework, all while juggling part-time statistics jobs within Cornell Athletics and the Cornell Ann S. Bowers College of Computing and Information Science’s Office of Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Belonging, to name a couple.
Once he changed up his priorities in the job hunt, Srinivasan got on LinkedIn and began reaching out to Cornell alumni. The goal wasn’t to get referrals, he said. It was to learn about industries, what companies need, and to discover where his MPS skills could be used.
Through CUeLINKS, he met a Cornell alumnus who was a recently retired hiring manager willing to review his résumé.
“After two days he gave me a call that went for two hours. He said, ‘Look, I’m going to go through your résumé section by section, and I’m going to tell you exactly where you’re going wrong,’” Srinivasan said. “People like him are the reason I chose Cornell. You just can’t imagine how willing some alumni are to help you.”
Srinivasan emphasizes that the Cornell alumni network has helped him at each step of his professional career, even before he arrived on campus in the Fall of 2022 for his first semester in the MPS program. He leaned on the Big Red alumni network when deciding to apply to the MPS program. As a graduate student, he connected with alumni to inform decisions around course selection and to network during the job hunt. Even today, he turns to them if he hits a technical snag in his current job.
“It made sense to me, as a student, to learn from these alumni,” Srinivasan said. “And even today, I can always reach back out to them.”
To new and prospective students, Srinivasan urges them to lean on critical program support staff within the Department of Statistics and Data Science, like Anita Scheible, career services advisor, and Allen Ward, graduate field coordinator, who helped him find part-time jobs on campus and prepare for job interviews.
As to his other piece of advice, there is no surprise.
“I would say talking to people has an even greater value in finding a job than sending off résumés for a job post,” he said. “Through networking and meeting people, you also begin to better understand industries and businesses, which will give you a head start over the rest of the crowd. That knowledge is very underrated.”
New and current MPS students with questions about networking or other aspects of the MPS program are encouraged to get in touch with Nirmal via LinkedIn.
Louis DiPietro is a writer for the Cornell Ann S. Bowers College of Computing and Information Science.

author: NewsBreak Original
title: Alexandra Johnson Honored for 60 Years of DAR Membership
text: BREWSTER, N.Y. -- The Enoch Crosby Chapter of the National Society Daughters of the American Revolution celebrated the holiday season with a luncheon, complete with a gift drive and a Yankee Swap at the Brewster VFW, along with its regular meeting. More than two dozen gifts were wrapped and donated to two Carmel families in need. Members were enthusiastic about supporting the community in this way and brightening the holidays for children who otherwise would not receive gifts due to difficult circumstances. In addition, chapter members participated in an annual gift card collection to support the Putnam/Northern Westchester Women’s Resource Center. Three new members were inducted: Meghan Reilly, Betty Spano, and Donna O’Creene Kern. Meghan Reilly and her sister Morgan are descendants of Solomon Hopkins, who served in the 7th Regiment of the Dutchess County Militia. A historic marker on Route 301 states that he would leave an upstairs window unlocked for his brother-in-law, Patriot Spy Enoch Crosby to come and go as needed. Betty Spano has found many familiar local names in her family tree including Adams, Tompkins, Smalley, Barrett, and Bennett through research over the last few years. Dawn O’Creene Kern, a newlywed, and new to genealogy research as well, appreciated the assistance of Libby Baker, Chapter Registrar. Holly O’Connor, membership chair and corresponding secretary, and Adrienne Davies, chapter chaplain, conducted the induction ceremony, introduced the new members and presented them with gifts and information to encourage their future participation. The chapter also honored Alexandra Johnson for her 60 years of membership. Her friendship is cherished and her service is greatly appreciated. Mrs. Johnson was inducted at the age of 18 in Brewster, with her mother, Mabel Holmes Addis and her aunt Marjorie Lobdell Addis, in attendance. Her grandmother, Esther Lobdell Addis was a founding member of the Enoch Crosby Chapter. Mrs. Johnson states that she enjoys the congenial camaraderie of the chapter and is continuing to research supplemental ancestors who participated in the American Revolution. Meetings in 2024 will be held on the second Saturday of each month at various locations around Putnam County, starting in February. Any woman 18 years or older, regardless of race, religion, or ethnic background, who can prove lineal descent from a patriot of the American Revolution is eligible to join. For more information or assistance with membership, please contact Regent Joan Hay at jehjbh@hotmail.com or Registrar Libby Baker at libbybaker@aol.com . Sign up to get local news from TAPinto in your inbox for FREE!

author: Elizabeth Rosas
title: Estados Unidos demanda a CVS Pharmacy por recetar opioides ilegalmente
text:
La demanda acusa a
 CVS de violar la Ley de sustancias controladas, la Ley de falsas reclamaciones, y de contribuir a la crisis de los opioides en EE.UU.
El Departamento de Justicia de
Estados Unidos anunció el 19 de diciembre una demanda civil contra la mayor cadena de farmacias del país, CVS, por recetar opioides ilegalmente durante más de una década y reclamar reembolsos a los programas de seguros de salud federales.
La demanda, interpuesta en un tribunal de Providente, Rhode Island, acusa a CVS, que tiene más de 9 000 establecimientos en EE.UU., de violar la Ley de sustancias controladas y la Ley de falsas reclamaciones, y en última instancia, de contribuir a la crisis de los opioides.
Te recomendamos
CVS habría recetado opioides ilegalmente
"Esta demanda argumenta que CVS no ejerció su papel clave como guardián de las peligrosas recetas de los opioides y, en su lugar, facilitó la proliferación ilegal de estos fármacos altamente adictivos", indicó en un comunicado el fiscal de Rhode Island, Zachary Cunha.
Desde 2013, CVS dispensó recetas médicas sin un propósito médico legítimo, no válidas o no resultantes de un proceso profesional, según la demanda, de "cantidades excesivas de opioides" y de una combinación de opioides, benzodiazepinas y relajantes musculares conocida como "trinidad".
Además, se indica que esas prácticas fueron resultado de los objetivos de resultados, los incentivos y las políticas de contratación de la empresa, que además, "privó a los farmacéuticos de información crucial" que podría haber reducido la prescripción ilegal de esos fármacos.
Video: YouTube |
Denise Espinoza
Las autoridades acusan a CVS de priorizar los beneficios sobre la seguridad de los pacientes y "sobrecargar" a los trabajadores de sus farmacias, de manera que "no podían cumplir la responsabilidad básica de asegurar que las recetas son legítimas".
CVS dijo a la cadena Fox que se defenderá y destacó que gobiernos locales y estatales del país llevan años litigando con esta y otras empresas por estas mismas causas, y en su caso firmó un acuerdo en 2022 por el que pagaba U$D 5 000 millones para resolver todas las denuncias de opioides en su contra.
Cada año, miles de estadounidenses mueren por sobredosis de opioides, presentes en analgésicos que las compañías farmacéuticas anunciaban a finales de los años 90 como sustancias seguras que no causan adicción.
Comparte esta noticia

author: Sanjesh Singh
title: US men's rugby eliminated in Olympic quarterfinals, will not medal
text:
Team USA will not medal in men’s rugby in Paris .
The Eagles on Thursday fell to Australia 18-0 in their quarterfinal matchup , ending a chance to at least claim a bronze medal in the competition.
Australia will move onto the semifinals on Saturday, July 27, where it will play two-time gold medalists Fiji .
The Eagles, though, haven’t played their last game. They will play Ireland on Saturday at 9 a.m. ET in the first of two placement games.
2024 Paris Olympics Dec 13, 2023 2024 Paris Olympics: See dates, sports, how to watch and more 2024 Paris Olympics Dec 21, 2023 Here are the rules for the 2024 Olympics in Paris 2024 Paris Olympics Dec 20, 2023 Get to know Team USA Olympians ahead of the 2024 Paris Olympics They can finish the tournament as high as fifth place or as low as eighth place, depending on the result between New Zealand and Australia.
Fiji, Australia, South Africa and France are the four semifinalists, though one will not medal.
Team USA has not yet medaled in men’s rugby since it entered the Olympics in 2016.

title: Canine Training Created Simple: The Energy of Good Reinforcement
text:
Qualifying your furry friend can be a cheerful knowledge when moved toward along with positivity. Positive reinforcement procedures feel like a top secret code that uncovers your pet's absolute best actions. Wondering what this means? It is actually everything about making use of perks, like addresses or even appreciation, to motivate p's and q's.
Envision showing your pet dog to sit. Instead of scolding all of them for certainly not knowing, make an effort something different. When they remain on demand, shower them with approval or give them an appetizing delight. In this manner, they connect sitting along with something really good. Remote control training is actually one more ace up your sleeve; it's a little tool that creates an unique 'click on' noise, denoting the specific second your canine does one thing right.
Using this approach, you are actually not only educating your pet, you're creating a connection. Terms like 'good boy/girl' or a favored treat ended up being symbols of accomplishment. Operant conditioning, a fancy phrase for this technique, essentially suggests satisfying actions you wish to observe additional of.
By paying attention to the positive, you're assisting your pet understand what pleases you. It's a win-win situation where your dog knows, and you both have fun in the process.

author: @rfi
title: En Cisjordanie, l'isolement numérique pèse sur la population
text:
En Cisjordanie, l'isolement numérique pèse sur la population
Le réseau satellitaire Starlink, propriété d’Elon Musk, a commencé à opérer en Israël. Il permet un accès toujours plus rapide à internet et aux télécommunications. Mais le milliardaire américain a décidé que son service n’assurerait pas la couverture réseau pour les territoires palestiniens. Une façon d’isoler un peu plus la population qui vit sous occupation israélienne, alors qu’en Cisjordanie par exemple, les Palestiniens n’ont accès qu’à une réseau 3G bien plus faible et capricieux qu’en Israël.
Publié le :
Avec notre correspondante à Ramallah, Alice Moreno
Si le centre-ville de Ramallah dispose d’une bonne couverture réseau, c’est beaucoup moins le cas dans les quartiers périphériques. Tarek agite son téléphone, visiblement agacé : « Le service, les communications en général, sont très faibles. Soit l’électricité est coupée à cause de l’occupation, soit les opérateurs ne diffusent pas, ce qui rend la connexion internet et les communications très lentes et pénibles. Autrement dit, si nous sortons de Ramallah, internet et les appels sont parfois inexistants. »
« Nous n’avons que la 3G »
Depuis les accords d’Oslo, conclus dans les années 90, c’est Israël qui a la main sur les ondes et fréquences en Cisjordanie, rappelle un jeune étudiant en ingénierie informatique : « Nous n’avons aucun contrôle sur le réseau ici. La décision ne nous revient pas, nous n’avons que la 3G, alors que partout dans le monde, actuellement il y a la 4G. Mais ici elle est interdite jusqu’à présent, parce que les autorités israéliennes ne veulent pas en entendre parler. Tandis qu’eux ont la 5G ! »
Décision injuste
Il n’est pas étonné une seule seconde par la décision d’Elon Musk de priver les Palestiniens du service satellitaire Starlink : « Sa décision est attendue, car il considère que n’importe quel bénéfice, n’importe quel progrès pour le peuple palestinien peut représenter un danger pour les Israéliens. »
S’il n’est pas surpris, il dénonce toutefois une décision injuste qui isole toujours un peu plus les Palestiniens du reste du monde.
